trial_identification.studytitle: Study Comparing OsseoSpeed Implants of Two Different Lengths in the Upper and Lower Posterior Jaw
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An Open, Prospective, Randomized, Multi-center Study Comparing OsseoSpeed Implant 6 mm With OsseoSpeed Implant 11 mm in the Posterior Maxilla and Mandible. A 5-year Follow-up Study.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - OsseoSpeed Treatment: devices - OsseoSpeed
Experimental: 1 -
Active Comparator: 2 -
Treatment: devices: OsseoSpeed OsseoSpeed implant, length: 6 mm
Treatment: devices: OsseoSpeed OsseoSpeed implant, length: 11 mm

primaryOutcome.outcome: Radiological assessments of marginal bone level alteration
primaryOutcome.timepoint: On a regular basis during 5 years follow-up

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Implant survival (on implant and patient level) Condition of periimplant mucosa Overall safety
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: On a regular basis during 5 years follow-up

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Provision of informed consent
- Aged 20-70 years at enrolment
- History of edentulism in the study area of at least four months
- Neighboring tooth/teeth to the planned bridge must have natural root(s)
- Presence of natural teeth, partial prosthesis and/or implants in the opposite jaw in contact with the planned bridge.
- Deemed by the investigator to have a bone height of at least 11 mm and a bone width of minimum 6 mm
- Deemed by the investigator as likely to present an initially stable implant situation
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Unlikely to be able to comply with study procedures, as judged by the investigator
- Earlier graft procedures in the study area
- Uncontrolled pathologic processes in the oral cavity
- Known or suspected current malignancy
- History of radiation therapy in the head and neck region
- History of chemotherapy within 5 years prior to surgery
- Systemic or local disease or condition that could compromise post-operative healing and/or osseointegration
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
- Corticosteroids or any other medication that could influence post-operative healing and/or osseointegration
- Smoking more than 10 cigarettes/day
- Present alcohol and/or drug abuse
- Involvement in the planning and conduct of the study (applies to both Astra Tech staff and staff at the study site)
- Previous enrolment in the present study.
- Severe non-compliance to protocol as judged by the investigator and/or Astra Tech
- Simultaneous participation in another clinical study, or participation in a clinical study during the last 6 months

recruitment.hospital: School of Dental Science, University of Melbourne - Melbourne

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to see if OsseoSpeed implant 6 mm long is effective for rehabilitation of edentulism and if so, how it compares with OsseoSpeed implant 11 mm long. The primary hypothesis is that the alteration in bone level is equal in patients randomized to 6 mm as to patients randomized to 11 mm implants.
